intro: Corispermum intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate corisperm, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in saline or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant has simple, usually hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in dry, capsule-like fruits, a characteristic feature of the family. Corispermum intermedium is often found in coastal areas and salt marshes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
